comments.body: i agree. it seemed like a tease that you can grab and have the ender eggs
have been wanting the dragon egg to hatch

i think the dragon egg should have 3 purposes, 1 to be a trophy which is already what it is and i think thats awesome already, 2, to be able to hatch a dragon and have it as a pet or flying type of mount. 3, replace or modify the current ender dragon re spawn mechanic to also include the dragon egg on top of the portal and have the end crystals recharge or hatch the egg into the boss again to fight and defeat.
The current purpose of the dragon egg is as a trophy

For some reason i feel like they had a thing in mind like this. I wish it would hatch into a tamed Dragon(non breedable) which would be insain . and have numorus uses. And i wish we could recollect the egg after beating it a second time and so on and so forth.
It will be awesome if you could travel with a dragon around the world and if severely damage my other mobs, it can regenerate. Anyways it was along way to get the dragon egg so I agree.

The ender-dragon egg is pretty plain.having a pet dragon is awsome.it is a cool trofy and all but it only sits there.if we could hatch fly and tame a baby dragon the end would be more interesting oh and before I forget the end needs an update!long-live the end!Love your game.byyyyyyyyyyyy!
Maybe you can even tame the dragon after you hatch the egg! I could fight for you and fly around attacking mobs. A cross between a dog and an iron golem!

I would like a pet dragon from the dragon egg, with a large amount of health and similar to the elytra. You could tame it like a horse, and have to feed it to regain its health. After 10 attempts to tame, the dragon could fly to a different location, and you would have to follow it to try again. It may render elytra useless if it comes into play, but they could coexist or the elytra can do things the baby dragon can't or the elytra could be armor for the dragon.
I agree there should be a choice to hatch the egg into a dragon, considering it is end game item having a pet dragon would surely enhance the game more.
I've Got ideas. Like you can ride it but it can't fly, it breathes dragons breath for you.
i think that the dragon egg should hatch and have a smaller, hostile dragon. it should attack anything not from the end

I also agree.

Alot of the bosses have a useful drop when you defeat them, why not the Ender Dragon?

It could...

-provide a way to teleport home in survival, possibly breaks after a few uses

-can hatch a pet dragon

-acts as an enderman spawner

-Instead of it disappearing after clicking it, it leads you to something, possibly another dimension or point of interest.

-Allows you to dream when you sleep at night

-Gives Enderman immunity,either

   - Enderman avoid where its placed or.

   - Are not hostile when you look at them while in range of it.

- Phantom Immunity

   - while placed, will create safehaven from phantoms
Yes! Mojang, I like your idea of water and fire dragons, but I would have liked a hatching version of the dragon egg.

But pls tameable and friendly plus everything that the ender dragon can do:

- poison balls

- flying

- growing as a bonus
you can make it as a pet
They do spawn in hot biomes but they shouldn't drop sand blocks.
If you make husk farms this would make TNT duping less viable or rather I should say less necessary. I agree this should be added.
I think it should maybe be dropped half as often as rotten flesh
An addition that if you have and zombie spawner in the desert they should spawn more in the spawner that drops more sand.

I had this exact same idea- It would motivate players to create biome-specific mob farms as opposed to relying on a single massive general mob farm. It would add a reason for adding zombie variants as opposed to completely different hostile mobs in different biomes. It would also make sand renewable which is much needed for massive servers and anyone who wants to use tons of glass and also preserve their Minecraft environment.

I think that this would be a great change, especially seeing as sand is weirdly one of the only things that isn't properly and legitimately renewable (i.e. not counting wandering villager trades or the end portal block entity dupe bug).
Also, like others have said, it would be more interesting to have to build a biome-specific farm to flesh out your world. There isn't really much reason to build anything in a desert at the moment - maybe this could change it a bit?

(Second also: zombie spawners in deserts should spawn husks, skeleton spawners in tundra biomes should spawn strays, and drowned in underwater caves!)

Do this so you can finally fix TNT duping. It seems like such an obvious solution to people in the technical Minecraft community, but given the nature of the size of the IP that is Minecraft, it is sometimes hard to get these rare good ideas through to the people that have the power to make the decisions.
I agree, as this would make TNT duping less necessary, and would hopefully stop people from using end portal duplication methods

I was just searching for this suggestion, with the goal of posting it myself if it hadn't been made. I'm surprised it has such a low vote count though.

One of the worst things about crafting anything that uses sand or sandstone is that players have to strip whole beach and desert biomes in order to get just enough for their projects â€“ especially on multiplayer worlds. Having an accessible source of renewable sand would cut back on the need to turn beautiful beaches and deserts into wastelands reminiscent of heavily-griefed anarchy servers.

Instead of a "rare" drop, sand should outright replace rotten flesh on the Husk, dropping 0-2 on death (increased with looting enchantments).

Fantastic idea, it would make sand renewable and farmable. Especially now when combined with the crafter, this gives players the opportunity to make TNT automatically to fuel their block farms, which currently use TNT duplication exploits to harvest blocks.
I'm for this! As a bedrock player that cannot duplicate TNT I keep having to rely on destroying deserts and resetting zones
I dont like the fire breath if its a forest boss i think there should be a ovean boss that is found inder the icey biome
I like the idea of the boss is but maybe make the spawn of it in the nether like its fire attack

I find it not suitable for Minecraft.
Why does it have trees on itself and breathes fire at the same time?
Why does it destroy everything?
How does it look exactly?
How does it fit at it's surroundings?
What's the point of it's existence?

I think that would be cool after you defeat the ender dragon so it unlocks something crazy but I don't think it would breathe fire if it is in the overworld. Would make more sense if it were in the nether or some new crazy dimension like a negative dimension?
Good idea

I think maybe something like that or maybe not destroy the world maybe it could be awakened when you stay near it for a bit, maybe it could summon trees where you are and maybe create revenes as an attack or summon the typical overworld mobs, like skeletons, creepers, zombies and spiders.
It could maybe be what dark is and maybe lives in the oacen (I can never seem to spell oacen correct) and maybe could look somewhat like the oacen monument looks like.
that is a little too OP

Would you summon this boss, or would it just be a general hazard?  All other bosses like that need to be summoned, so I would hope that this one would be too.  Especially if it can break blocks.

The other thing is the nether might be tame to you, but there are other people who are still terrified of it.

I think the wither is technically a nether boss, since you summon it with things from the nether.  It just can be summoned in any dimension, so people don't necessarily associate it with the nether.
it should be a general hazard cuz nether is too neutral (except for fortress) and it only appears near lava oceans so... if you keep your distance you'll be safe
isn't the wither the nether boss?
Look at the Wither
lol wither is the nether boss

I would love to see something added to the Nether such as this. The Wither is kind of a boss in a sense, but it is spawned outside the Nether. I feel like adding a "mini-boss" to the Nether would solve this, and instead of spawning the Wither with soulsand, there would be a special block the mini-boss would drop. The Wither would also have to be spawned in the Nether.
i think maybe it would spawn when you kill 100 of a nether mob.
I agree a nether boss is needed. The bastions are destroyed. What destroyed them? What did the Piglins fight? A boss could answer this.

What if the Nether boss was a Piglin King/Warrior? Something that might spawn in the bastions to make them more difficult (I think the Piglin with the giant flail from CaptainSparklez "Take Back the Night" music video is a good example).

I Wouldn't say a new nether boss could, sense mojang tends to set the wither as the nether boss. Maybe a piglin chief In the bastions who wields a guilded netherite sword? But @Floridafam also gave me the Idea of a new Event: The ambush.

 

My Idea Is to add yokai as the nether's counterpart to Illagers, with splash potion using, sword wielding bakenekos and their kitsune chief replacing your typical vindicator, as well as Beautiful and deadly okamis who summon non-destructive yet explosive fireballs along with their spirits as replacements to the evoker. Even massive Onis who wield axes and nekomatas who use bows with poison AND weakness arrows and potions to aid themselves replacing your ravegers and pillager army.

They could drop new their weapons as well as new totems, like a totem of will that Increases damage when you lose health, alongside new potions and brewing Items.

 

You could find "hungry camps", where yokai and hostile wraiths live. And entering a bastion With bad omen, which can be given In the nether by killing a okami shogun, which Is just an okami with a banner, will trigger an ambush.
The wither is the boss of the nether. But I would enjoy a new nether boss.

For those that are saying that the Wither is the Nether boss, I disagree. The Wither can be spawned anywhere it is placed. Now if you could only place it in the Nether, I would agree with it being a Nether boss. However, it is not exclusive to the Nether. Previously, you could only place the Wither in the Overworld (food for thought). 

 

I would say a good Nether boss would incorporate one of the biggest aspects to the Nether...lava. The Nether boss could be a massive lava/stone monster (great concept of this would be the Redstone Monstrosity in Minecraft Dungeons). This "Nether Monstrosity" would be summoned from the giant lava lakes. Because of the Nether Monstrosity size, and preference to lava, players would need to find higher ground to fight it. The Nether Monstrosity could throw boulders at the player, shoot fire, and slam the ground (causing players to be tossed into the air and knocked backwards. Minecraft has a serious lack of boss fights. And the two that are in the game currently are pushovers. Players want a challenge.
It would be nice if the boss of the nether had an undead look like a piglin fresh out of lava dressed in gold with a weapon that can drop you, that summons blazes and piglins.

I would like to see a giant lava squid in a little temple arena in the Lava oceans of the nether. You would need a strider to get there and it shoots fire balls at you and swings with it's tentacles after you. If you kill it you would get lava leggins that resemples the tentacles and let you swim in lava. It would have 1400 health (700 hearts), the fire balls deal 6 damage (3 hearts) and they set you on fire, the tentacles would deal 10 damage (5 hearts) and they would throe you and your strider up into the air. The strider wouldn't get hurt from this
the boss can be a lava monster who spawns fireballs

i think wither is half nether boss. it doesn't show up in the nether. but this idea is nice.

ps. i think it should drop loads of XP and it should drop nephrite ingots
oh maybe what's missing is the wither should be stronger in the nether and weaker in the overworld and end so maybe the overworld lacks something!

It should give only one effect that lasts for 30-40 seconds. Otherwise, 3 positive effects for a minute are too OP.

They should also give you fungi stew when using bowl on them. First, you will have to feed them their matching fungus and then use the bowl. Crimson gives you Fire resistance and Weakness and the Warped one gives you Nausea and resistance. All these effects last for 25 seconds.

These stews could also be craftable by using bowl, 4 fungi and nether wart.

Also Fungi stew could be crafted using bowl, 2 crimson and 2 warped fungi and nether wart. This one would give you all effects.

Um you mean the Mesa Bioms? And I love the Idea. I love falcons and hawks and owls and would like to see them all in Minecraft

I think this would be great, it could be easy since there are already parrots in the game! 
If you were to use the parrots as a base then while its not sitting or on your shoulder it could fly around if there isnt a fence in your chunk, yes it would be cool that you attack to send it out, but it would be inconvenient, but if it were to be on your shoulder when you attack it could come off to help you fight what you're fighting, or if its roaming then when you attack something it would swoop in to help, this would also make hunting more fun, heres an example, you have your bow and you want to kill a cow to get some leather or beef, you shoot the cow and then your falcon swoops down and finishes it off!

Exactly. Should also be different variants like hawks and eagles. The eagles and hawks should fly more slowly than the falcons too. Could be two diferent kinds of eagle. The Fish-eating eagle (I forgot the name), and the Golden in eagle of the Mongolian Desert. Should exist in different biomes but will always spawn in and have nests in high altitudes. When their nests are approached they fly away . You should stay still and crouch while holding the meat used for taming in your hand. They will slowly approach you and then you could tame them. Kind of like taming stray cats. Also this idea can bring many people together, since a lot of cultures use birds for hunting.

I love this idea. Maybe Mojang could implement this with the upcoming mountain update (peregrine falcons live pretty much everywhere). We definitely need new mob pets, since wolves, cats and parrots are the only mobs that follow without having to use a leash or food.

The falcon could have variants like the peregrine falcon, and falcons could dive really fast, and if it dove on a player it would hurt the player and have a 50% change to knock them out(the player would wake up in 5 seconds and it would be nighttime by then.If the falcon knocked the player out at nighttime, the player would wake up at daytime.

Oh, also i have another idea. Possibly to give them a unique use, when you die instead of teleporting to you they pick up as many items as they can in their talons and beak (max 5) and bring them back to you!

I love this idea, though I don't think they should be tamed tamed. Perhaps it could be done like foxes where you have to breed your own for it to trust you or maybe a temporary week long tame and then you have to feed it again to tame it again.

Falconers are not friends with their Falcons and their Falcons are never domestic- they only stick around for the food they've grown to associate you with. I think it should be the same in game.
Yess I would love to see falcons in the game, having another tamed animal that also can help hunting sounds really fun to play.

I like this idea.
To be honest it makes a lot of sense, considering how ice is slippery. Overall I think it would be a cool addition (no pun intended).
Or glass.

I think it is an OP skill for spiders to climb everything too, and having them be unable to climb *at least* blue ice would be super helpful. Though applying that to all types of ice would definitely be more realistic

I would love for a block that spiders can't climb. Most blocks makes sense, but all blocks seems like a step too far. Ice makes perfect sense as something you wouldn't expect spiders to be able to climb.
This is a great idea. It makes total sense.

I love this idea. I came across it as I was about to suggest "spiders can't climb on honey," which I think is a solid alternative, especially since honey has a special context for how mobs interact with the sides of the block.

Another idea (also using honey) could be that after touching a honey block a spider couldn't climb, which could be illustrated with a skin that has honey on their feet, and little honey-colored particles when they walk. This could be something that wears off with time, or wears off when they get in water and wash it off. The latter would be interesting since you'd probably be trying to push spiders with water at the same time as you want them not to climb.
I would love to see this and/or Glazed Terracotta. I always wondered why it was that Slime canâ€™t stick to Glazed Terracotta but Spiders can? But Ice also makes a lot of sense too

I agree, but the Mooshroom biome is intended to be a place of rare refuge. Maybe it could be guarded by some rare mobs with cool drops(like a unique weapon etc... since islands are very rare), but once the mob is defeated, the island is forever safe.

I like the general idea but disagree in regards to hostile enemies. The mushroom biome is really unique in that itâ€™s a place entirely devoid of hostiles and I feel it should stay that way. That being said, the idea of more mushroom variant animals is definitely an appealing one â€” if someone can come up with enough punny names. It would also have to have enough of a purpose, it just wouldnâ€™t sense to add them in otherwise. Alright, so for some reason, my caribou suggestion made 2 months prior to yours was removed so I'm just gonna repost the whole thing in the comments here:

Model by MCvinnyq#7463 on Discord.

Caribou are peaceful, antlered mammals that spawn in forests and cold biomes such as taiga or ice plains. What's great about caribou is that both males and females grow antlers, so in Minecraft, they can easily be ambiguous.

Much like turtles, caribou have set "home" biomes. An idea I've considered is that the caribou could have two home biomes so they can migrate like they do in real life, but there would be an issue with chunk-loading. So I think it would be best if caribou just had a set home where they graze; then they can wander off and then come back every few days.

Caribou can be tamed with carrots to become Reindeer which can be ridden and can carry saddlebags. What's special about reindeer is that they can move especially fast through snow biomes.

Much like how chickens lay eggs, caribou could infrequently shed their antlers. Antlers can be used to convert obsidian blocks into Obsidian Shards; whether that conversion is via crafting or mining is up to the developers. It'd be fine if it was by breaking obsidian as long as the player can't craft obsidian blocks with the shards.

Antlers can also be used as heraldry in banners!

Caribou will also drop Raw Venison, which when cooked is slightly better than Steak. Leather will also be dropped.

To LordSugarBear and Rudquack, the chance of scrap had been increased to 1/142. I took your suggestion to make it rarer. However I didn't want to make it almost impossible to drop, netherite ingots are very difficult to make so I wanted to add that just to make it a bit easier. Plus these guys are like phantoms, except bigger, they shriek, and do more damage. So you already have to deal with that just for the chance. So, I think I hit somewhere in the middle. Thank you for your feedback!

Fighting chicken like phantoms in a forest where if you look at anyone you will be attacked seems to difficult. But that is also why I added them to the Basalt deltas. That is their true home, they only go to the Crimson forest for food. In the basalt deltas, nothing can reach them but Ghasts. So their eggs and babies are safe. Thank you for your feedback!

To Nicolas Lau, Yes, just not fire resistant. And to CyclicalFish147. The rarity has been increased of the skulls, also added was the rarity of Screecher nests. They are rare now. Simple as that. Thank you for your feedback!

Well, for me, wandering trader is used to get a lot of unique plants, when I can't find their biomes, so it would make sense for wandering traders to sell bamboo. However I don't really agree with the rest of this post, although renewable hearts of the sea sound good too.

AlI wanted to say is described better in a different comment above by someone named A Whimper.

The wandering trader is quite useless for late game players after people have setup a slime farm, found a warm ocean, found a jungle biome, etc. Here's some ideas for trades that would be useful. 

  • 1 emerald for 1 iron ingot
  • 64 emeralds for 1 netherite scrap
  • 32 emeralds for 1 diamond. 
  • Possibly enchanted books with treasure enchantments such as frost walker and mending but not soul speed with a super rare chance. 
  • 2 emeralds for 1 wither rose

I think the wandering trader should be able to interact with your world stats to unlock rarer items for trade.

For example, once you've killed 25 blazes, blaze rods could have a chance to be a rare trade.
same goes for shulker shells at 25 shulkers, and magma cream after 25 magma cubes. These numbers could be tweaked for more or less kills of a particular mob. Spider webs could be a potential rare trade at 100 spiders. Maybe sponges after 9 elder guardians killed.

Basically a chance to get difficult, rare, or annoyingly grindy items once you've achieved enough, but no way to avoid doing it properly the first time. This would make the trader more sought after in the endgame, rather than just a nuisance.

I do think the wandering trader should sell more things, but not useful things because that allows the player to easily beat the game, which is why they don't have diamond trades in the first place. I think the wandering trade should be able to trade animal/ non- hostile spawn eggs, because that would make it easier for the players to get some more pets at their base, like a panda, if their house is on a mountain island. Plus, spawn eggs wouldn't really help the player, so it would be a great way of getting spawn eggs in survival.

He should also sell items based on the biome you have you have not visited. He 'wanders' for petesake. He should not offer saplings or flowers in a biome that's full of it. Also, he's a trader. Make him buy stuff from with items that tend to be 'in excess'. My logic is that he'll sell these excess items for a higher mark up as he wanders away.

In addition to the being far away from villages thing, I think that the player should be able to sell stuff to him. this could be small things, a bit of supplies for his journey and whatnot. Stuff like

  • Wheat/Carrots/other crops
  • Food
  • Coal
  • A bucket of Water

I'm just spit balling ideas here, it would make it easier to trade with him.

I think he should frequently have items that are hard to find, like rare biome specific items (cocoa beans, allium, etc.), but he should also sell enchanted books, pottery fragments, music discs, and other items that are findable or craftable but a pain in the butt to obtain.

The trade slots should be ranked, with the first few being common items from outside of the current biome, the next two being items from uncommon biomes, and the last being a rare item, like a high level enchanted book, pottery fragments, music discs, etc. The latter should be so rare that it doesnâ€™t replace things like archaeology or getting creepers killed by skeletons, just complement them.

You guys do know that the wandering trader does not kill mobs for mob heads, or ceratin loot. nor does he goes to the end or ether dimesion. No I think his trades gotta be overworld biomes related, and structer related(that does'nt have them face mobs like pillages and droweds. like heart of the sea, berrys, and bucket of axelot.(although many of your ideas are great.)

One of the comments mentioned that the Wandering Trader only sells items from biomes you have not visited and especially not from your current biome. I think alternatively it would be very cool if the Wandering Trader was willing to buy items from biomes you've been to as well as your current biome
That's a good idea!

The Wandering Trader could also benefit from an item for item trades, like 10 spruce saplings for a Dark oak or Jungle sapling, 10 pufferfish for a potion of water breathing, 64 wheat seeds for 16 chicken eggs. These sorts of trades would make the Trader accessible, help exchange items for potentially more useful things or even Emeralds (20 copper blocks=1 emerald). Mining for emeralds takes a while, and unless you go to villages most players won't have a stack of emeralds around. Logically Traders and Merchants would barter goods for goods as well, so lore-wise it fits nicely.

It would be great if he could sell:
- sweet berries
- bamboo
- bucket of axolotl
- bucket of tadpole
- maybe also turtle and chicken eggs
- sculk blocks
- mycelium

A rare trade offer with valuable items is also a great idea, but it should not be overpowered. For example random potions or the same loot one can get as a treasure from fishing. Maybe also mob heads (excluding wither skeleton) just for LOL

With the new updates to villager (librarian) trading and that they need to be a biome specific librarian in order to get certain enchantments of books, you could have the wandering traders have a chance of selling those books/biome specific trades.
